title: We love: fashion fixes for the week ahead – in pictures
description: Beyoncé brings back double denim, Skepta goes hiking and the return of the 80s power suit Continue reading...
author: Jo Jones and Sam Deaman
excerpt: Beyoncé brings back double denim, Skepta goes hiking and the return of the 80s power suit
text: Team layerWorn by an ever-growing number of celebrities, including Hailey Bieber, Emily Ratajkowski and Kendall Jenner, the Ultralight collection from Intimissi is the perfect light layer for spring, under a short sleeve T-shirt, blazer or knitted vest. £45, intimissimi.com Make wavesBen Sherman’s summer B by Ben Sherman collection takes inspiration from Brighton’s yacht clubs. Map and boating prints sit alongside French terry sets, and retro-inspired shorts offer a nod to 90s sportswear in candy-coloured chino fabrics. Polo shirt, £85, bensherman.co.uk Boots made for walkingBritish grime musician Skepta continues to reinterpret Puma’s heritage and design codes with the launch of the new Skope midboot. For 2025, the hiking-style silhouette is reimagined in a sleek black leather and light grey mesh palette, accented by bold turquoise laces for an elevated finish. Available in unisex sizing 3-11, £200 puma.com Working itH&M’s latest studio collection channels 1980s corporate women and the vibrant style of Miami and Los Angeles. Think sharp belted coats, chic business shirts to sexy bodysuits and the LBD; it’s all about, strong shoulders, cinched waistlines and sporty details. Accessories include an oversized water-repellent clutch, metal frame sunglasses and angular shaped shoes. From £19.99-£379.99, hm.com Natural charmBritish designer Priya Ahluwalia has collaborated with Pandora on six engravable charm and pendant jewellery designs that pay homage to her dual Indian-Nigerian heritage. Designs within the collection include the ‘Paisley Print’, which is synonymous with Indian embroidery, and ‘Flower of Nigeria’ which represents a Costus Spectabilis, the flower of the Nigerian nation. From £45, pandora.net Quilt tripCraig Green and Eastpak join forces to present a collection of quilted bags. The collaboration infuses Eastpak’s iconic designs with Craig Green’s utilitarian style and workwear influence. Embracing form and function with three padded designs featuring a quilted exterior, rubberised nylon buckles, and purpose-built compartments. From £85, at eastpak.com In the pocket‘Pool Hall,’ the second chapter of the REIIMAGINE campaign, sees Beyoncé back sporting a Canadian tuxedo for her collaboration with Levi Strauss & Co. The superstar and denim brand linked up last September for a year-long campaign that has Queen Bey recreating famous Levi’s ads from the past. Part two sees the singer in a braided denim vest, wide-leg jeans and trench with custom embellishments while playing pool, reinterpreting the 1991 ‘Pool Hall’ ad. From £65, levi.com
